title: Turtle Wax-inspired global theme and component styling updates

requirements.summary: Update global theme tokens (colors + default text styling) to a Turtle Wax-inspired palette and ensure consistent readable contrast site-wide.
acceptanceCriteria: The global Tailwind/CSS variable tokens (e.g., background/foreground/primary/secondary/accent/muted/border/ring) are updated so the site’s dominant colors and text colors visually match the Turtle Wax-inspired theme.
Text colors across all major sections (Header, Home hero, Brand sections, Brands section, About section, Footer) are consistent with the new theme and maintain readable contrast.
No blue/purple becomes the primary brand color (keep within the Turtle Wax-inspired palette while meeting accessibility/contrast).

file_operations.description: Replace the existing charcoal–orange CSS variable theme with a Turtle Wax-inspired palette by updating --background/--foreground/--primary/--secondary/--accent/--muted/--border/--ring (and related *-foreground variables), plus dark-mode equivalents, keeping strong contrast and avoiding blue/purple as primary.

Align root-level CSS theme tokens with frontend/src/index.css (or otherwise ensure it does not diverge) so any builds referencing this file still use the Turtle Wax-inspired palette and readable default text colors.

Adjust Tailwind theme configuration only as needed to support the updated token-based theme (e.g., ensure ring/border/background/foreground token mappings remain correct and optionally refine typography defaults to keep headings/body text consistent with the new theme without introducing blue/purple as primary).

requirements.summary: Apply the updated theme tokens consistently across key UI sections and components by adjusting Tailwind classes for headings, links, dividers, badges, and hover states.
acceptanceCriteria: SiteHeader navigation text, hover states, and header background/border styling align with the new theme tokens and do not look like the previous theme.
HomeHero gradient/background, headline accent color, and decorative blobs are updated to match the new theme palette.
BrandSection divider color and ProductCard hover/active styling (including title hover color) match the new theme.
BrandsSection icon accent backgrounds/colors and card styling match the new theme.
SiteFooter link color and icon styling match the new theme.

file_operations.description: Update header background/border opacity choices and navigation/link hover states to use the new theme tokens (primary/secondary/accent/foreground/muted-foreground) so the header reads as Turtle Wax-inspired rather than charcoal–orange.

Retheme hero background (gradient or solid), headline accent color, and decorative blob colors to use the updated theme tokens (e.g., primary/secondary/accent) consistent with the Turtle Wax-inspired palette and high contrast text.

Update the section divider and heading styling to match the new theme tokens (e.g., divider uses the new primary/secondary accent) and ensure brand section text colors remain consistent with global defaults.
Retheme product card hover/active states, border/shadow emphasis, and title hover color to use the updated theme tokens (primary/accent/border/muted) while maintaining readable card-foreground text.

Update brand cards and icon accent blocks to use the new theme tokens (e.g., primary for Turtle Wax-inspired highlight, secondary/accent for alternate brand highlight) and ensure card text uses foreground/muted-foreground appropriately.

Adjust typography classes (including Tailwind Typography 'prose' overrides via utility classes) so headings, body text, and feature icon accents use the new theme tokens consistently and remain readable.
Update footer background/border styling and link/icon colors to use the new theme tokens (foreground/muted-foreground/primary) so footer links and the heart icon align with the updated palette.
Update section background wrappers (e.g., Brands section background) to use the updated theme tokens consistently across sections, avoiding legacy accent tints that resemble the prior theme.
